title: Assignment 4: (Discussion) Termination is due
description:
You work as a forensics investigator for a large organization. The head of Human Resources has just notified you that they are terminating the employment of an employee who was a suspect in an internal harassment investigation. What steps will you take to acquire and preserve evidence?

Be specific about the steps you take, the order in which you take them, and the tools and techniques you expect to utilize.

After your post your description, you will be able to see what others posted as well. Respond to at least one other post by suggesting how they can improve their investigation.

Due dates:

	* Initial post should be posted no later than Sunday (February 9, 11:59pm)
	* Replies must be posted no later than the following Tuesday (February 11, 11:59pm)

title: Assn 2 – p. 101/2.1, 2.2, 2.8 is due
description:
2.1 What is the purpose of system calls?

2.2 What is the purpose of the command interpreter? Why is it usually separate from the kernel?

2.8 How could a system be designed to allow a choice of operating systems from which to boot? What would the bootstrap program need to do?

title: Summary 3: Evidence Processing is due
description:
Submit a summary of the week's readings BEFORE our weekly meeting.

Critical thinking: In addition to your summary, include topics that were not fully clear to you and list any questions that you would like to discuss in class. Relate what you read in this week's readings to issues discussed previously or to your own existing knowledge.

title: Sprint Report 1 is due
description:
Upload the report of your first sprint no later than two days after its completion. 

Review the sample report for guidance.

Report highlights must include:

	* Sprint start and end date, its goal, and a reflection on its level of completion
	* Sprint Accomplishments in paragraph form. Make sure to explicitly include a description of the testing you performed if you developed software.
	* Overview of tasks and issues included during this sprint and their level of completion
	* Any changes made to the scope of the current sprint, and a detailed description of why you decided to include them in this sprint, rather than add them to the backlog. Include a NUMBERED list of changes.
	* All key decisions made during this sprint, including a brief rationale. Include a NUMBERED and DATED list of decisions
	* An overview of all problems that you encountered, and to the extent possible, an explanation of their resolution. Include a NUMBERED list of problems and their resolution
	* A work effort report outlining how much time each individual team member logged
	* If you developed (partial) deliverables such as design documents, product reviews, etc., include them as appendices

Only one team member is required to upload the report. The report must be a .pdf-file

title: Research Conference Abstracts is due
description:
Post the abstract for the research conference here and provide meaningful feedback to at least one proposal that is not your own. After finalizing your abstract, DO NOT FORGET TO SUBMIT IT TO THE RESEARCH CONFERENCE [1] AS WELL!

Only one member of each group has to post an abstract, but everyone must provide substantial feedback to at least one other post.


Links:
------
[1] https://aurc.adelphi.edu/submit-abstract/

title: Assignment 5: Mindtap Exercises is due
description:
COMPLETE THE FOLLOWING CENGAGE MINDTAP ACTIVITIES:

	* Module 4,  Lab 4-1: Processing Crime and Incident Scenes

title: Individual Reflections is due
description:
Your final individual deliverables must include a personal reflection on lessons learned, group dynamics, and problems encountered. The reflection must be approximately two pages long.

Reflections will be kept confidential.
